False 2015-02-17T23:00:00Z 2015-02-16T08:38:04Z for-journalists for-journalists For journalists Resources for journalists SOER 2015 is the fifth edition of the 'European environment \ufffd\ufffd\ufffd\ufffd\ufffdstate and outlook 2015' report, published by the European Environment Agency every five years. SOER 2015 presents the most comprehensive picture of Europe\ufffd\ufffd\ufffds environment ever published and\ufffd\ufffdis made up of two reports and 87 online briefings. These comprise the \ufffd\ufffd\ufffdSynthesis\ufffd\ufffd\ufffd report and the \ufffd\ufffd\ufffdAssessment of global megatrends\ufffd\ufffd\ufffd report, complemented by 11 global megatrends briefings , 25 European briefings , nine cross-country comparison briefings , 39 country briefings (based on national state of environment reports), and three regional briefings . There are several resources to help navigate this wealth of information: Press release , in 26 languages The Synthesis report , in many languages Assessment of global megatrends report EEA Executive Director Hans Bruyninckx explains the main findings of SOER. This can be downloaded for use by broadcast media (mp3) . Videos of the SOER launch press conference , downloadable in high resolution for use by broadcast media. Infographics \ufffd\ufffd- contact us if you would like to have files in another format. Promotional video The SOER presentation: quick facts and figures Photo gallery . Many more images illustrating the SOER are available on request - contact us for more details The EEA press office The EEA\ufffd\ufffd\ufffds press officers can help journalists understand what is most relevant and interesting for specific countries. In many cases they can also provide background data which could form the basis of excellent stories. Contact: I ben Stanhardt Arthur Girling Press Officer iben.stanhardt@eea.europa.eu \ufffd\ufffd \ufffd\ufffd \ufffd\ufffd \ufffd\ufffd \ufffd\ufffd +45 33 36 71 68 Press Officer arthur.girling@eea.europa.eu \ufffd\ufffd \ufffd\ufffd \ufffd\ufffd \ufffd\ufffd \ufffd\ufffd\ufffd\ufffd +45 33 36 71 09 soer2015 eea eea target audience modern 55.67594 Copenhagen 12.56553 False 100 2015-03-04T10:27:27Z False False kobosnic False soer2015 eea target audience eea Resources for journalists

SOER 2015 is the fifth edition of the 'European environment \ufffd\ufffd\ufffd\ufffd\ufffdstate and outlook 2015' report, published by the European Environment Agency every five years. SOER 2015 presents the most comprehensive picture of Europe\ufffd\ufffd\ufffds environment ever published and\ufffd\ufffdis made up of two reports and 87 online briefings. These comprise the \ufffd\ufffd\ufffdSynthesis\ufffd\ufffd\ufffd report and the \ufffd\ufffd\ufffdAssessment of global megatrends\ufffd\ufffd\ufffd report, complemented by 11 global megatrends briefings, 25 European briefings, nine cross-country comparison briefings, 39 country briefings (based on national state of environment reports), and three regional briefings.

There are several resources to help navigate this wealth of information:

  • Press release, in 26 languages
  • The Synthesis report, in many languages
  • Assessment of global megatrends report
  • EEA Executive Director Hans Bruyninckx explains the main findings of SOER. This can be downloaded for use by broadcast media (mp3).
  • Videos of the SOER launch press conference, downloadable in high resolution for use by broadcast media.
  • Infographics\ufffd\ufffd- contact us if you would like to have files in another format.
  • Promotional video
  • The SOER presentation: quick facts and figures
  • Photo gallery. Many more images illustrating the SOER are available on request - contact us for more details

The EEA press office

The EEA\ufffd\ufffd\ufffds press officers can help journalists understand what is most relevant and interesting for specific countries. In many cases they can also provide background data which could form the basis of excellent stories.

Contact:

Iben StanhardtArthur Girling

Press Officer

iben.stanhardt@eea.europa.eu\ufffd\ufffd \ufffd\ufffd \ufffd\ufffd \ufffd\ufffd \ufffd\ufffd

+45 33 36 71 68

Press Officer

arthur.girling@eea.europa.eu\ufffd\ufffd \ufffd\ufffd \ufffd\ufffd \ufffd\ufffd \ufffd\ufffd\ufffd\ufffd

+45 33 36 71 09
